Заходи – не бойся, выходи – не плачь...

Баланс, направленный в сторону выживших, очень и очень раздражает. Большинство убийц зависят от перков и аддонов, в то время как выжившие и без перков могут загенрашить. Просто попробуйте поиграть на легионе, охотнике, клоуне и др пеших убийцах без перков на остановку генраша и поймёте.

Баги, возможность растянуть разрешение через конфиг и увеличить fov за счёт этого.

Дикий гринд радужных осколков и отсутствие такой проработки дейликов, как в мобильной версии. Огромное количество платных dlc и отсутствие возможности купить все dlc разом и подешевле в составе какого-нибудь "ultimate edition"

Отдельно стоит упомянуть swf - это просто пиздец. Вы понимаете, они в игру, которая рассчитана на то, что у выживших нет какой-либо коммуникации, ДОБАВИЛИ ВОЗМОЖНОСТЬ ИГРАТЬ В ПАТИ. И от этой хуйни нельзя никак отказаться, нет такой кнопки, вы будете бегать за одним выжившим, в то время как остальные рашат генераторы, ибо уже в курсе, что вы к ним не придёте. 

Подытожим: игра неплохая, но главная проблема заключается в том, что игра на выживших не требует особого скилла и фановая, в то время как игра за убийцу напряжённая и требует огромного опыта. Как по мне, должно быть наоборот.

12 осколков и полторы часов / 10 паллетлупов

DbD é um daqueles jogos que você vai querer jogar. Dentro do estilo dele (co-op, horror assimétrico) é o mais bem feito e criativo. Você vai se divertir jogando. Maaaaas, ai entram duas questões que, pra mim, fazem o jogo não valer a pena. Primeiro, esse jogo te deixa estressado. Se você não tem calma, nem jogue esse jogo. As pessoas são extremamente ofensivas e não aceitam perder. Os sobrevivente te zoam todo momento possível, abusam do jogo e se você não for muito bom como killer, você irá se estressar muito, afentando sua vida real. Outro problema é que a empresa é totalmente irresponsável na questão de banimento. Fui banido do jogo sem motivo e sem chance de ser ouvido, além de não provarem nada. Tem vários casos na internet semelhantes. Devem fazer isso para você comprar outra cópia, o que seria viável, já que em promoção o jogo sai por menos de 15 reais, bem barato. Imagino que façam isso pelo mesmo motivo de venderem DLC em lote: ganhar dinheiro fácil em cima da comunidade. Por falar em DLC, o jogo básico é 20%, o resto é tudo DLC paga. Então, em resumo, o jogo tem idéia boa e é divertido, mas infelizmente a empresa que administra o mesmo é mercenária e corrupta.

Não vale a pena aceitar tudo que uma empresa força só pra jogar.

After a couple of hours on Dead By Daylight, it is finally time I give my opinion. 

I would recommend this game because even though it is popular for its many negative aspects, it has been a great time for three years. I first thought every person playing killer was hacking until I played it myself. I quickly realized that it is mostly made for killers. However, once you get the hang of it, you can loop easily. I have seen many survivors that made me want to pull out my hair playing killer. 

I would say the most downfall of Dead By Daylight is the community. Sometimes, I would get "hate comments" in the chat once the game was over, even though all the survivors escaped. Instead of being happy about winning, they had to drag me down. Which is not very nice. 

However, I have met many people on this game that I can call my friends to this day. It has created great memories of me screaming every time a Myers would pull me out of the gen and good laughs teabagging my dead body while being morried by the killer. One advice I would give is to play with people you know. Playing with randoms is a 50/50 chance you'll get unhook. 

If you enjoy a bit of horror and great time with your friends, you should get this game.

Dead by Daylight deserves to be talked about in the same breath as Prop Hunt and TF2 as GOAT multiplayer games. With friends or solo it's an absolute blast. Even when I'm getting my ass kicked as killer I'm having a good time. I can't recommend it enough. I had it on Playstation Plus but I decided to get it on Steam because it's worth actually owning.

Also give us Twin Peaks DLC. BHVR I'm begging you.

All I can say is that the game is very fun and original.

It has  asysmetric teams 4 Survivors vs 1 Killer.  Survivors have to evade Killer, fix generators, to open gates to escape.  Killer must knock down survivors, then hang them on  a hook, from which they can be rescued, to sacrifice them to "The Entity".

The gameplay is easy to pick up, but difficult to master.   Each survivor and killer will have different advantages and disadvantages on each map.  Some survivors are louder than others when they move, or are wounded.  Killers have some unique ways they apply their attacks.  Eventually you will need to learn each map section by section.  Some survivors are better and evading killers by jumping down from a height,  Some killers need let the survivors fix a couple of generators, while they set up defenses around a few key generators.

The Devs do a great job supporting the game.

Some of the killers are balanced to take on 4 friends on Discord as opposed to 4 randoms, but to me this makes it more fun.

The survivor and killer characters and their different outfits, lets the player create a wide variety of video game tropes.  They also license "Texas Chainsaw Massacre", "Halloween", "Nightmare on Elm Street", and most recently "Stranger Things".

You will probably want to mix and match Perks, and that will mean leveling a lot of different characters up to levels 30 to 40.  But it really isn't that difficult because their are a lot of ways to get bonus points to level them.   

Pro's:
- Fun and unique gameplay.
- Great Dev Support

Con's"
-  You may shit your pants against when some of the killers pop up behind you pulling you off a generator.
-  Community can be a little salty.

Dead by Daylight’s a little too repetitive to be your next online gaming feast, but it’s one hell of a palette cleanser; the game that, when you’re grown a little tired of PUBG, Fortnite, Destiny or whatever, you can keep coming back to for new thrills and terrors. There’s definitely space for a sequel with a little more depth and substance, but one of the great online games of the last few years still goes from strength to hellish strength, and there’s never been a better, time to face your fears and break the nightmare.
